reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious and clean with comfortable beds. We had the standart twin room and it was great! Big, quite, nice decorated, with a large window and a small sofa.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: The bathroom was also very big with a huge shower, a bathtub also, and double wash basins.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: Looks a little rough from the outside (they were painting it whilest we were there) Inside amazing. Great location, 100 yards from the tramstop. Next to the river, Rooms have all mod cons ( no kettle) nice size, clean, modern. The breakfast is amazing, everything you could possibly want.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night with a couple of friends as part of a long weekend away.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: Check in was friendly and fast - however the person checking us in didn't say anything about an upgrade. We'd booked two premium rooms as they have balconies and we wanted to smoke. We were disappointed to find that there were no balconies in our rooms and only when we returned to the front desk was our upgrade to "grand" premium explained. There was nothing different about the "grand" premium rooms, except that they didn't have a balcony. Weird. It turns out only one room with a balcony was available, so one of our party could have that. A frustrating start.
reviews.title: 5 stars at 3 stars price

reviews.text: The room itself was a good size, but it seems caught in a time warp. The huge bathroom with jacuzzi bath and separate shower, double sinks, bidet etc etc was decidedly 70s. The lamps in the room didn't work first time, the selection of TV channels was poor - no on demand movie options that I could see.
reviews.title: very good hotel in a very good place to be in bilbao

reviews.text: The wifi was shockingly poor, given the price for 24 hours. There were no instructions about it so I called the front desk - someone needed to come to my room with a user name and password written down. A few minutes later they arrived. It was difficult to get a wifi signal on my iPad after I eventually got a connection. The signal strength was very poor and I had to repeatedly log back in.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Good Location
perfect location,comfort and service
reviews.text: stayed two nights in this excellent hotel. we were upgraded to a superior room which fully justified its name. Large, confortable, with a beautiful view.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Service was excellent, very good breakfast and the location most convenient for the Guggenheim, the airport and the town.

reviews.title: Grat hotel and ll you need for a City break location
reviews.text: Could not be better.

reviews.title: excellent futuristic hotel
reviews.text: Some of the pictures for this hotel make it look a bit strange - concrete, slightly brutalist with an overly large/impersonal lobby. In fact it's a warm and friendly hotel offering smart, modern rooms, excellent breakfast and bar as well as warm pool. The location is fine - Bilbao is a small City, so you are 20 minutes walk to the old town and 10 minutes to the main shopping area. The Guggenheim is 5 mins or less away. Staff here are excellent. Will stay again.

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in Good Location
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days, during the Bilbao festival.

reviews.title: Really good value, good quality, great location
reviews.text: First tine in Bilbao and I'd recommend this for a short break. Obviously there is the Guggenheim but the rest of the city is worth looking round and the old town has a great atmosphere.

I booked this hotel because of the Melia brand and was amazed at the price for B&B when booking. The room was a good size, had great views over the river and was well equipped. breakfast was very good with a fine range options.
reviews.title: A good choice
